result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ralph J. Noonan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:30 a.m. Defendant Ralph J Noonan in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard today: 14CF102, 14CF388, 15CF19, 14CF389, and 14CF390.   Amended Information filed in 14CF102 (amends count 1) and waived reading.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  Jail, consecutive each count (totaling 120 days) and costs for 14CF102 and 15CF19 Cts 1 & 2 and 4 uncharged read ins of 15PT237, 14PT2285, 15PT26 (bail jump) & 15P26 (Disorderly Conduct/domestic abuse).
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF102, 15CF19 ct 1 & 15CF19 ct 2 No contests 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF102, 15CF19 ct 1 & ct 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 14CF388, 15CF19 Ct 3, 14CF389, 14CF390 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Rushevics makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
14CF102 amended Ct 1: 30 days jail, report today for start date serve within 60 days, with huber work, counseling and for child care if jail can properly monitor it.  Electric monitor if eligible can serve the last 60 days on home monitor. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
14CF102 Ct 2: Pay costs & DNA surcharge.

15CF19 ct 1: 45 days jail, consecutive to each other and 14CF102, report today for start date, with huber work, counseling and for child care if jail can properly monitor it.  Electric monitor if eligible can serve the last 60 days on home monitor. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
15CF19 ct 2: 45 days jail, consecutive to each other and 14CF102, report today for start date, with huber work, counseling and for child care if jail can properly monitor it.  Electric monitor if eligible can serve the last 60 days on home monitor. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
1 day jail credit
Status conference on July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
for Substitution of Counsel from Drengler to Rushevics /s/ TBE 12-08-14
Pre-trial conference on December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ralph J. Noonan in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF388, 14CF389, 14CF390

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Comply with the bond in 14CF102.
This bond covers all files: 14CF388, 14CF389, 14CF390

Defendant Ralph J. Noonan in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF388, 14CF389, 14CF390

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Cousins recommends a $500 cash bond to cover all 3 files with conditions as stated. 
Atty Drengler asks the original signature bond from this other files.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
